department.dept_long_name: Department of Romance Languages and Literatures

course.title: Brasil hoje: Contemporary Brazilian Culture through Media
course.meeting_text: Fall term: Tu., Th., 11:30-1. Spring term: Tu., Th., 1-2:30
course.faculty_text: Clemence Jouet-Pastre and members of the Department
course.description: Engages in systematic grammar review, along with practice in writing and vocabulary enrichment, while examining contemporary Brazil as presented in Portuguese-language press, television, literature, and film. Analyzes the ways Brazilians and non-Brazilians construct different and conflicting images of Brazil and "Brazilianness." Issues of race relations, national identity, ethnicity, and gender addressed. Discussions based on historical and literary texts, advertisements, films, videotapes of Brazilian television, and current issues of newspapers and magazines.
course.prerequisites: Portuguese C, S-Dx, or permission of course head.
course.notes: Conducted in Portuguese. Not open to auditors. May not be taken Pass/Fail, but may be taken Sat/Unsat by GSAS students.
